title: Print, "The Artist in the Country, from Appletons' Journal of Literature, Science and Art, June 19, 1869, Cover", 1869
medium: Wood engraving  on white wove paper
signed:
Signed on knapsack, lower right: WH
Signed, lower left: J. Karst.
inscribed: Caption: THE ARTIST IN THE COUNTRY. BY WINSLOW HOMER.
provenance: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
creditline: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
description: Artist with porkpie hat and mustache sits on a camp stool at a portable easel under a white umbrella.  A knapsack in the right foreground is evidence of the overland trek required to reach such a remote site in the White Mountain wilderness.  Well-dressed young lady watches artist at work.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "The Artist in the Country, from Appletons' Journal of Literature, Science and Art, June 19, 1869, Cover", 1869.
1869. Wood engraving  on white wove paper. Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund. 1938-47-1.
